author: Adagov.Org
title: Open Ideas and Data For Cooperation
description: The Catalyst Community cant use IdeaScale API because it holds private member data. \[1\]. We lose time curating data by hand each fun \[2\]\[3\].

assessments.note: This project makes a good case for a better system of  analysing the data around project proposals, assessment and voting

The problem and solution statement described is reasonable. The proposal is within the scope of the challenge and has great potential to not only improve decision making, but to create tools and a data management model to improve various processes that today are problematic and fragmented between IdeaScale and independent tools. There is a long-term plan, which is a positive point and increases the long-term impact.

The proposal is a continuation of a work that is already being developed and is already showing positive results in decision making through several swarm sessions where several members of Catalyst participate regularly to improve several points of Catalyst, among them decision making.

This proposal has a very confusing layout so took me a while to understand the objective. For example the objectives of this proposal are well layed out in the end in the "Impact" section, this should have been layed out in the beginning. There is also a lot of unnecessary content, like the "Truth about Data" section which is not required to understand the proposal. Saying that the proposal identifies real issues with IdeaScale, like the difficulty in finding information from previous funds and so it address the challenge. I'm not sure if replacing IdeaScale with a new platform is the best solution, specially when no concrete alternative is being proposed. The proposers offer more of a wish-list of things they would like to improve, but not much of plan on how to achieve those.
assessments.reply: Complaint about the order in which questions are answered and providing context to people who may not be data literate.

assessments.note: This is a really good idea, create an alternative for Ideascale which is centralized and bring it to the community and more, create a better environment which allows an easier navigation. This is totally coherent with the whole crypto idea.
The plan is well detailed and proposer had relevant experience to deliver.

The proposer, Ro Mathew, has been developing work related to this proposal for several weeks, a large part of the deliverables referring to the Fund4 proposal (not yet voted / nor funded) has already been completed, which shows commitment. I recommend the inclusion of a link to Linkedin so that the community can check your skills transparently. In the proposal there is a description that several administrators will be "hired" to assist in the management of the platforms as well.

The proposal is a continuation of the "Adagov.org (Co-creation)" proposal. The plan and the established budget are reasonable and are detailed, giving continuity to what was presented in the proposal of Fund4.

Due to the complexity of the proposal, there is a risk that Adagov.org will not be used as intended. The decision to use a platform other than IdeaScale is uncertain and depends on several factors. Despite this, I think it is important that we use an open source platform that is more flexible and that meets the demand of the Catalyst community.
this team rocks , they already have a running project they just don't come here with an idea they come with a under construction project !

It gives no doubt that this is feasible, since there is a lot that has been already made. 
There's just two things that makes me wondering: 1 – if the fund4 do not get voted which will be the real downgrade to fund5 project? ; 2 – In the problem statement you said "[…] can't use ideascale API because it holds private member data", however you've not well explored the security problem (since it's an off-chain platform which everyone could contribute). Maybe addressing these two problems to clarify everything would be a great incrementation to the project.

Furthermore, in 'feasibility' would be a good thing to see things more well explained. Point 3, for example, if the negotiation is not successful, what will be the actual risk or downgrade?
Proposal provides significant detail and discusses the issues with the current system and how this would help to remedy them.

The description of the problem and solution is clear and the proposal is in line with the challenge

Several deliverables have been described, dates for their delivery have been defined, but the absence of KPIs makes it more difficult to audit the proposal. There are details on the budget allocation.
Considering the fact that the budget is considering the management of the platforms for two years, I think it is important that the roadmap contemplates this term as well, since the deliverables described have a later date for implementation in 12 months.

There's a budget breakdown, but it still leaves some open questions for example in these two items: "Review and Identification Tasks $1000"
"Swarm Sessions and Training $2500", what would the funds be used for, to pay someone for x hours of work ?
You also requesting funds to pay licenses for 3 platforms for 2 years, since this proposal emphasis on a trial and feedback-loop based iterations would it not be wiser to commit to smaller time-frame ? 
There is no clear roadmap of expected timelines presented, just "Our objective is to have a smoothly working alternative dataflow and data reporting setup as soon as possible."
assessments.reply: Clear timelines are shown next to the deliverables. Further breakdown of pricing would be impossible at this stage. Enterprise platforms require yearly pricing and should negotiation fail, we have budgeted to get the project done.

assessments.note: I think that would be of a great help if you could add a gantt chart to give a more visual way for us to verify what depends on the voting of the f4 and what this will affect in the final product.

solution: Build data pipelines off-chain to integrate proposal and community tools in a form suitable for integration by structures of accountability.
experience: Ro Mathew is a ML Lead, ex PM Decision Support Systems with 10+ Years Experience in BA, DS and Product Management.
